column4: for whatever reason, my computer refuses to boot from usb with ubuntu server on it
is there a way to specify, in grub or ubuntu, to start the ubuntu 10.04 installer from the usb drive?
I've tried booting from USB first but no dice - I've done this before without issue but there seems to be some angst with Server 10.04
disabling all drives except the usb drive (which is recognized in bios)
for what its worth, unetbootin and usb-creator-gtk both encounter this problem
i'm getting the typical "invalid boot device, please insert bootable media etc etc"
do you know the per-session boot menu key prompt
you mean my bios boot menu? yeah i've tried that, no dice
no there is a out of the bios key prompt hit at boot as if going to the bios mine is f12 yours may be different
yeah, that's what i meant by boot menu
i assure you we're speaking about the same menu
there is the bios boot from menu and another one outside the bios
